intro: [WRONG START] Hieracesium paldiskiense, commonly known as the Paldiski hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Paldiski region of Estonia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and ray florets. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and along riverbanks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered with fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and protected species in its native range.
